gobblin.broker.iface

Interface ScopeType<S extends ScopeType<S>>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - itself.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GobblinScopeTypes, SimpleScopeType

    public interface ScopeType<S extends ScopeType<S>>
    Represents a DAG of scope types. For example, the topology of a distributed application might have scopes as follows: 
     GLOBAL -> INSTANCE --> JOB       --> TASK
                    \-> CONTAINER -/
    Where global represents multiple separate instances or even other applications, the instance creates containers and process jobs, and each task of a job is run in a container. As seen in the graph, instance is a child of global, job and container are children of instance, and task is a child of both job and container.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      ScopeInstance<S> defaultScopeInstance() 
      boolean isLocal() 
      String name()
      The name of this ScopeType.

    • Method Detail

      • name

        String name()
        The name of this ScopeType.

      • isLocal

        boolean isLocal()
        Returns:
        Whether this _scopeInstance is process-local or shared across different processes.

      • parentScopes

        @Nullable
Collection<S> parentScopes()
        Returns:
        Collection of parent scopes in the DAG.

      • defaultScopeInstance

        @Nullable
ScopeInstance<S> defaultScopeInstance()
        Returns:
        a default ScopeInstance for this ScopeType, or null if no such default exists.

      • rootScope

        S rootScope()
        Returns:
        the root ScopeType in the DAG.
